intro: Dyerophytum pendulum, commonly known as the hanging milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its slender, drooping stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species in suitable climates. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
